column2: The reactor\xc2\x92s gonna blow in three seconds, we\xc2\x92re never gonna\nmake it!'
You\xc2\x92ve got to get out of here! Save yourself!'
No! I won\xc2\x92t leave you!'
Don\xc2\x92t worry about me, I\xc2\x92m a robot! I\xc2\x92m just a machine!!'
No you\xc2\x92re not! Not to me!'
(she stops reading from the script) Oh my God.'
What?'
I am extremely talented!'
Yeah, you\xc2\x92re great! Okay, let\xc2\x92s take it from\xc2\x85'
(interrupting) No, I mean I was really acting my ass off.'
Yeah, I thought I was pretty good too.'
Oh yeah, you\xc2\x92re solid. Yeah, you\xc2\x92re just no me.'
Y\xc2\x92know what? I think that\xc2\x92s enough for now. Yeah. I don\xc2\x92t\nwant to be over rehearsed.'

(tremendously overacting) Fine! I\xc2\x92ll do it without you! (Joey gives\nher thumbs up) I don\xc2\x92t need you or anybody else! I\xc2\x92m gonna make it on my own!\n(Joey closes the door to his bedroom.) You\xc2\x92ll see!! You\xc2\x92ll all see!! '
(To Joey) So uh, what\xc2\x92s this thing you\xc2\x92re auditioning for?'

Oh, it\xc2\x92s a new TV show. Yeah. I\xc2\x92m up for the part of Mac
Macaveli or "Mac." Yeah, I\xc2\x92m a detective and I solve crimes with the help
of my robot partner. He\xc2\x92s a, he\xc2\x92s a Computerized Humanoid Electronically
Enhanced Secret Enforcer or-or "C.H.E.E.S.E."'
So Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.'
That\xc2\x92s the title! Yeah! Y\xc2\x92know they really lucked out that the\ninitials spell cheese.'
That is lucky.'

Huh\xc2\x97Wait so Joey if you get this, you\xc2\x92re gonna be like the\nstar of your own TV show! I mean you\xc2\x92ll be like the Big Cheese! (To Phoebe) Or the\nBig Mac\xc2\x97Hey! You love those!'
Well, don\xc2\x92t get your hopes up, because probably not gonna happen.'
Now-now, why would you say that Joseph?'
I mean come on you guys! My own TV show? I just don\xc2\x92t know if\nI\xc2\x92m good enough.'
I am.'
Joey, what are you talking about? You\xc2\x92re a terrific actor.'
You really think so?'
Ugh, how can you even ask that question?!'
\xc2\xa0 Whoa, she's pretty. (Mentioning the girl on TV)"
\xc2\xa0 Yeah, and oh she's really nice too. She taught me all about how to\nwork the cameras, and smell-the-fart acting."
\xc2\xa0 I'm sorry, what?"
\xc2\xa0 What?'
\xc2\xa0 Excuse me?'

\xc2\xa0 It's like, you got so many lines to learn so fast, that sometimes
you need a minute to remember your next one. So while you're thinkin' of it, you take this
big pause where you look all intense, you know, like this. (Does this intense look where
it looks like he's smelling a fart.)"
\xc2\xa0 Oh, ok.'

(there's a gunshot on TV) There's my scene, there's my scene. [Joey on
tv] "Mrs. Wallace, I'm Dr. Drake Ramoray, your sister's neurosurgeon.\xc2\xa0 I'm
afraid the situation is much worse than we expected. Your sister is suffering from
a..." (Does the smell-the-fart look.)'
(on stage in an Austrian accent) Vell, Eva, ve've done some excellent vork\nhere, and I vould have to say, your pwoblem is qviiite clear. (He goes into a song and\ndance number.) "

\xc2\xa0 I play Al Pacino's butt. All right? He goes into the shower, and
then- I'm his butt.

Monica
\xc2\xa0 Yes.'
\xc2\xa0 So you gonna invite us all to the big opening?'
All right well, I\xc2\x92m outta here. Wish me luck.'
(overacting with a song this time) (singing) Gooood luck! Gooood\nluck! We all wish you good luuuuuuuuck!!!'
Yeah, whatever. (Exits.)'
It\xc2\x92s your turn.'
Oh, are we playing this?!'
(entering, dejectedly) Hey.'
Hey! How\xc2\x92d the audition go?'
Terrible! I messed up every line! I shouldn\xc2\x92t even be\nan actor!'
Wait a minute, are you doing that thing where you pretend it didn\xc2\x92t\ngo well but it really did go well?'
Yeah, did I fool ya?'
Totally!'
So it did go well.'
Oh, it went amazingly well!'
Great!'
Oh that\xc2\x92s great!'
Yeah-yeah, it\xc2\x92s down to me and two other guys.'
Oh my God!'
Wow!'
And I know both of them, they\xc2\x92re really good. One of them is the guy\nfrom those allergy commercials who\xc2\x92s always getting chased by those big flowers\xc2\x85'
Oh, I love that guy! (Laughs.)'
Oh-oh, what are you doing?'
(stops laughing) What am I doing?'
I\xc2\x92m just so nervous! Y\xc2\x92know? The callback isn\xc2\x92t until\ntomorrow at five. I feel like my head is going to explode!'
Well, it is overdue.'
Look, don\xc2\x92t worry. Okay? You\xc2\x92re gonna be fine.'
There\xc2\x92s just so much pressure. I mean no offense, but what you guys\ndo is very different. I don\xc2\x92t know if you\xc2\x92d understand.'
Yeah, none of us have to deal with pressure at our jobs.'
(on phone) Yes, Fran. I know what time it is, but I'm looking at the\nWENUS and I'm not happy!"
\xc2\xa0 Alright, well I'm tearing the lettuce."
\xc2\xa0 Uh-huh. Is it dirty?'
\xc2\xa0 Oh-oh, no no don't worry, I'm gonna wash it."
\xc2\xa0 Don't, I like it dirty."
\xc2\xa0 That's your call."
\xc2\xa0 So, uh, what are you going to do next?'
\xc2\xa0 Well, I thought that I would cut up the tomatos.'
\xc2\xa0 Are they, uh, firm?'
\xc2\xa0 They'r alright."
\xc2\xa0 You sure they haven't gone bad? You're sure they're not very,\nvery bad?"
\xc2\xa0 No really, they're OK."
\xc2\xa0 You gonna slice them up real nice?'
\xc2\xa0 Actually, I was gonna do them jullienne.'
\xc2\xa0 Aaaahhhhhhh.'
\xc2\xa0 I'm outa here. [Monica leaves]"

\xc2\xa0 (on the phone) Monica, I\xc2\x92m quitting! I just helped an 81 year
old woman put on a thong and she didn\xc2\x92t even buy it! (Pause) I\xc2\x92m telling you
I\xc2\x92m quitting! That\xc2\x92s it! I\xc2\x92m talking to my boss right now! (Pause) Yes I
am! (Pause) Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Okay bye, call me when you
get this message. (Hangs up.)'
\xc2\xa0 Well, what happened?'

\xc2\xa0 Well, he came in for a massage and everything was fine until...\n(The flashback shows Paulo lying face down on the massage table and slowly moving his\nhands up Phoebe's legs and grabbing her butt.)"
\xc2\xa0 Ohhhhhh!'
\xc2\xa0 Oh my God!'
\xc2\xa0 And all of the sudden his hands weren't the problem anymore. (The\nflashback shows Paulo rolling over and showing Phoebe his equipment.)"
\xc2\xa0 Was it...'
\xc2\xa0 Oh, Boy Scouts could've camped under it!"
You ate my sandwich?'
It was a simple mistake. It could happen to anyone.'
(getting upset) Oh-oh really? '
Now-now calm down. Come look in my office, some of it my still\nbe in the trash.'
(jumping to his feet in anger) What?'
Well, it was quite large. I-I-I-I-I had to throw most of it\naway.'
You-you-you-you (trying to remain in control) threw my sandwich away!'
\xc2\xa0 (losing control, we hear him shout outside) MY SANDWICH?!!!'
MY SANDWICH!!!!!! (Ross's scream scares a flight of pigeons away.)"
I want this part so much! Y\xc2\x92know? If I don\xc2\x92t get this part\nI\xc2\x92m never gonna eat Macaroni and Cheese again!\xc2\x97No, I didn\xc2\x92t say\nthat! That\xc2\x92s a lie.'

Oh come on guys, it\xc2\x92s not like I moved to Europe! I just moved
across the hall! And we would have you over all the time if it weren\xc2\x92t for
(struggles to get this out) Monica\xc2\x92s allergies. (The duck quacks.) You\xc2\x92re right,
I could never lie to you. She hates you. (The phone rings.) Should I get that? (Laughs,
then answers the phone.) Hello? (Listens) Uh no, Joey\xc2\x92s not here right now. Can I
take a message? (Listens) Yeah, okay so the audition has been moved from 5
(startled) Ahh! Aren\xc2\x92t you dressed yet?'
(looks down at his clothes) Am I naked again?!'
We\xc2\x92re supposed to meet my parents in 15 minutes.'
Yeah okay, I was just talking to the guys. Just look at them I mean,\nis it okay if they come visit?'
Wh?! What about my allergies?!'
Oh right, your allergies. (Monica leaves and to the chick and duck)\nAll her, she hates you. (Chandler leaves without finishing the message for Joey.)'
Yes!! Ha-ha!! All right! Hey! How cool would it be if you could watch like\na real life-sized version of this? Huh? I mean how crazy would that be?'
As crazy as soccer?'
(on phone) Hello? (Listens) What are you talking about? The\naudition\xc2\x92s not \xc2\x91til 5
You mean you didn\xc2\x92t get it from this?'
The allergy guy got the part! Thanks!'
Well, maybe we can fix it y\xc2\x92know? Maybe we can send him some-some\nbig-big flowers and scare him!'
How could you do this to me Chandler?! This part could\xc2\x92ve turned my\nwhole career around!'
I messed up. Okay? I\xc2\x92m sorry, I really messed up.'
Hey, you don\xc2\x92t even live here anymore! What are you doing answering\nmy phone? I have my machine!'
Which I bought for ya. Taught ya how to use it. You thought it was a\ncopier. Look, if there was anything I could do, I would do it. Okay? But everybody\xc2\x92s\nallowed one mistake, right?'
\xc2\xa0 You know he coulda gotten me a VCR, he coulda gotten me a set of\ngolf clubs, but no, he has to get me the woman repeller!\xc2\xa0 The eyesore from the\nLiberace house of crap!'
\xc2\xa0 It's not that bad."
\xc2\xa0 Oh, yeah, easy for you to say, you don't have to walk around\nsporting some reject from the Mr. T collection. [Joey walks in behind Chandler]"
\xc2\xa0 Chandler, Chandler.'
\xc2\xa0 I pity the fool who puts on my jewelry, I do, I do. I pity the\nfool that. . . [turns around and sees Joey] Hi!'
\xc2\xa0 Yeah, I mean when you were late last night, Kathy and I got to\ntalking, and one thing to another and\xc2\x85'
\xc2\xa0 And what?! Did you sleep with her?!'
\xc2\xa0 No! No! No! I just kissed her.'
\xc2\xa0 What?!! That\xc2\x92s even worse!!'
\xc2\xa0 How is that worse?!'
\xc2\xa0 I don\xc2\x92t know! But it\xc2\x92s the same!'
\xc2\xa0 You\xc2\x92re right, I have no excuses! I was totally over the\nline.'
\xc2\xa0 Over the line?! You-you\xc2\x92re-you\xc2\x92re so far past the line,\nthat you-you can\xc2\x92t even see the line! The line is a dot to you!'
Look, I\xc2\x92m not saying that you should magically forgive me! But\nyou\xc2\x92re not perfect! You\xc2\x92ve made some errors in judgment too!'
Name one!'
(lets him out) What happened?!!'
(getting out) Awww, man! He promised he wouldn\xc2\x92t take the chairs!!'
\xc2\xa0 What the hell happened?!! How were you locked in?!! And where\nthe hell is all of our stuff?!!'
\xc2\xa0 Well, this guy came by to look at the unit and-and he said he\ndidn\xc2\x92t think big enough to fit a grown man!'
\xc2\xa0 So--You got in voluntarily?!'
\xc2\xa0 I was tryin\xc2\x92 to make a sale!! Oh, man, if I ever run into that\nguy again, do you know what I\xc2\x92m gonna do?'
\xc2\xa0 BEND OVER?!!!'
Ok, now, remember, no trading. You get the pretty one, I get the mess.'
Hi, Joey. (Sees Chandler.) Well well, look what you brought.'
...And what did you bring?'
She's checking the coats. Joey, I'm gonna go wash the cab\nsmell off my hands. Will you get me a white Zinfandel, and a glass of red for Janice."
Janice?'
Janice?!'
Oh.... my.... God.'
Joey's tailor...took advantage of me."
What?'
No way!\xc2\xa0 I've been going to the guy for 12 years."
Oh come on!\xc2\xa0 He said he was going to do my inseam, and he ran his\nhand up my leg, and then, there was definite...'
What?'
Cupping.'
That's how they do pants!\xc2\xa0 Ross, will you tell him? Isn't that how\nthey measure pants?"
Yes, yes it is. In prison!'
I said name one!'
I can\xc2\x92t believe I did this! What an idiot!'

Oh, stop beating yourself up! People make mistakes! These things happen!\nThere aren\xc2\x92t any message you\xc2\x92ve forgotten to give me are there? (Chandler has a\ndisgusted look on his face.) Apparently you\xc2\x92re not very good at it! I\xc2\x85'
Do you think he\xc2\x92ll ever forgive me?'
Of course he will! But Chandler the most important thing is you forgive\nyourself!'
Y\xc2\x92know what? I-I kinda have.'
Already? That\xc2\x92s pretty bad what you did.'
Y\xc2\x92know what? He will forgive you. And I like to bring a pad\nwith me when I go answer the phone just in case\xc2\x85 (Chandler gets that disgusted look\nback.) Okay\xc2\x85'
You didn\xc2\x92t see how mad he was, y\xc2\x92know?'
I\xc2\x92m sure he will forgive you. Look, we have all been there!\nY\xc2\x92know, you fight, you make up, it\xc2\x92s just the way it works.'
It took two people to break up this relationship!!'
Yeah! You and that girl from that copy place, which yesterday you took\nfull responsibility for!!'
I didn\xc2\x92t know what I was taking full responsibility for! Okay?! I\ndidn\xc2\x92t finish the whole letter!'
What?!!'
I fell asleep!'
(mocking him) You fell asleep?!'
It was 5
Y'know I can\xc2\x92t believe I even thought about getting back\ntogether again! We are so over!!"
(starts to cry) FINE BY ME!! (he opens the door and traps Chandler behind\nit)'
And hey! Just so you know, it\xc2\x92s not that common! It doesn\xc2\x92t\nhappen to every guy! And it is a big deal!!'
(coming out from behind the door) I KNEW IT!!!!'
You had no right to go out with him.'
That is the most ridiculous...'
You sold me out.'
I did not sell you out.'
Yes you did.\xc2\xa0 You absolutely sold me...'
Would you let me talk. [flicks Monica on the forehead]'
Did you just flick me?'
OK, well, you wouldn't let me finish and I was jus- [Monica flicks her\nback] Ow. That hurt [flicks Monica]"
Oh!\xc2\xa0 All right.\xc2\xa0 Now, let's not do this!"
Happy thoughts!\xc2\xa0 Happy thoughts!'
OK, now I'm gonna kick some ass."

column1: (Phoebe grabs each of them by an ear.)\n\nMonica and Rachel
column2: Ow! Ow! Ow!'
I know!\xc2\xa0 I know!\xc2\xa0 I know! '
Alright, now I will let go if you both stop.'
Fine!'
Fine!'
There we go.You know what, if we were in prison, you guys would be,\nlike, my bitches.'
Okay, buddy-boy. Here it is. You hide my clothes, I'm wearing everything\nyou own."
Oh my God!\xc2\xa0 '
Look at me! I'm Chandler! Could I be wearing any more clothes?\nMaybe if I wasn't going commando..."
Yeah. Whew, it's hot with all of this stuff on. I ah, I better not do any,\nI don't know, lunges. (starts doing lunges)"
Joey and Rachel's apartment, Chandler is entering with a peace offering of a\nJoey Special, two pizzas.]"

Joey? Got you a Joey Special, two pizzas! Joe? (The phone rings
and he answers it) (On phone) Hello? (Takes the phone away from his mouth when he realizes
what he just did and yells.) Damnit! (Back on phone.) Hello? (Listens.) No, Joey\xc2\x92s
not here right now, but I can take a message I think. (Listens) He\xc2\x92s still got a
chance for the part?! Oh, that\xc2\x92s great news! (Listens) Well no obviously not for the
actor who was mauled by his dog. (Listens) Oh well, that\xc2\x92s great. I will give Joey
the message. Thank you! (Hangs up and goes to write the message on the Magna-Doodle.)
Yes! (Reading what he\xc2\x92s writing) Okay, Mac audition at 2
Hey!'
Please tell me you got the message!'
What message?'
The actor playing Mac couldn\xc2\x92t do it, they needed to see you at 2\no\xc2\x92clock.'
What?! It\xc2\x92s 6 o\xc2\x92clock!'

Du-du-I wrote it, I wrote it on the board! I wrote it on the board,\nthen I went all over New York City looking for ya! I went to Ross\xc2\x92s! I went to the\ncoffeehouse! I went to any place that they made sandwiches!'
I can\xc2\x92t believe this Chandler!'
Sorry! I-I-I don\xc2\x92t know what to say.'
Well you-you-you-you might say congratulations! I saw the board! I went to\nthe audition! I got the part!!'
(angrily) Is that supposed to be funny! I was really worried over\nhere!'
Oh, well I\xc2\x92m uh\xc2\x85'
Y\xc2\x92know, sometimes that fake out thing is just mean!'
Oh wow! Okay man, I\xc2\x92m sorry. I did not mean to make you feel bad.'
Well that\xc2\x92s good. Because you didn\xc2\x92t! And I\xc2\x92m\nincredibly happy for ya!!'
(shocked) That\xc2\x92s mean! You really had me going there!'
Oh, we could do this all day.'
Yeah, you\xc2\x92re right. Okay look, listen, let\xc2\x92s talk about what a\nhuge star I\xc2\x92m gonna be!'
You are gonna be a huge star! I\xc2\x92m gonna hug ya!'
You hug me!'
All right!'
Hey, do we do this too much?'
I think so. Yeah, get off me.'
Yeah.'
Come on C.H.E.E.S.E., I\xc2\x92m not leaving without you! Try routing your\nbackup source through your primary CPU.'
(overacting badly) I can\xc2\x92t! My circuits are fried! They\xc2\x92re\nfried I tell you!!'
Wow! (Back to reading the scene.) Well then I\xc2\x92ll just have to carry\nyou.'
That\xc2\x92ll be a neat trick, when you\xc2\x92re, (looks at the script) when\nyou\xc2\x92re dead!'
Ross, you don\xc2\x92t have to yell.'
There was just an explosion, okay? My hearing would be impaired. '
I thought you were excellent! In fact for a minute there I was like,\n"Ooh, where\xc2\x92d Ross go?"'
Thank you! And I have to say that first scene when you meet Mac\xc2\x85'
Yeah?'
Oh my God. I mean\xc2\x85'
Y\xc2\x92know what? I think that\xc2\x92s enough for today. Thanks for your\nhelp! (He grabs their scripts and heads for his room.)'
(To Ross) He\xc2\x92s holding us back.'
Totally.'
